Legal_Issue: Whether the Board's decision denying refugee status was reasonable under the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Application_Facts: Applicant sought refugee protection based on domestic abuse and fear of Boko Haram
Decision_Outcome: Board’s decision found to be reasonable; judicial review dismissed
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Board’s decision
Grounds_for_Claim: Past domestic abuse, threats from Boko Haram, gender-based persecution
Legal_Standard: Reasonableness standard for mixed questions of fact and law
Assessment_Factor: Well-founded fear of persecution, application of Gender Guidelines, credibility of claims
Applicable_Legislation: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, subsection 108(4)
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review conducted by Federal Court
Review_Standard: Reasonableness requiring justification, transparency, and intelligibility
Credibility_Assessment: Board found no well-founded fear of persecution despite applicant's arguments
Evidence_Used: Alleged past abuse, threats from Boko Haram, gender-based risk factors
Legal_Provision_Cited: Subsection 108(4) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Application_Basis: Fear of persecution due to domestic violence and Boko Haram threats
Evidence_Assessed: Threats from Boko Haram, history of domestic abuse, compliance with gender-based guidelines
Relief_Sought: Refugee status and protection under IRPA
Governing_Rule: Reasonableness standard applies to Board's decisions on refugee claims
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Applicant failed to demonstrate errors in the Board’s application of Gender Guidelines or subsection 108(4)
Outcome: Judicial review dismissed; no certification question arose
Harm_Assessment: Risk of harm from domestic abuse and Boko Haram in country of origin
Cause_Description: Applicant claimed persecution based on gender and association with Boko Haram threats
Evidence_Handling: Board assessed evidence and found insufficient basis for well-founded fear
Evidence_Issues: Insufficient evidence to establish a well-founded fear of persecution
Evidence_Assessment: Board reasonably concluded no well-founded fear existed
Decision_Rationale: Decision was justified, transparent, and intelligible; no reviewable error found
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of demonstrated error in evaluation of evidence by the Board
